item.title: It's Time for a New Old Language
item.description: William (Bill) Gasarch writes on the Computational Complexity blog about a recent talk that Guy Steele gave at Harvard on Harry Lewis’s 70th birthday: Guy Steele gave the most technical talk and it was, as the kids say, awesome (do adults still say ‘as the kids say’?) Here is a version of the talk: A Logial Concern Its about how papers at POPL and some other conference have been informally using a language to specify protocols and by now its all bent out of shape.

  2. February 2017. Communications of the ACM Volume 60 Issue 2

item.title: Welcome to the all new TechGlider!
item.description: The aim of this GitHub site is to disseminate high quality content related to Computer Science, research, programming and general technology. We have a GitHub organization for collaboration, a Twitter account for announcing updates and a Slack channel for discussion. Stay tuned!
